utterances.transcript_with_note: Gunther, can I get another cup of coffee, please? (Gunther starts to pour him another cup.) So uh, what do you do when you're not working here?

utterances.transcript: You don't need to fill these silences.

utterances.transcript_with_note: Oh, okay, thanks. (He goes back to the couch and rejoins Monica, Joey, and Phoebe.)

utterances.transcript: Chandler, that's like your fourth cup of coffee!
Well, I am drinking lots of cups of coffee because I'm exhausted! Because Joey started snoring!
He's in a different room! He's really that loud?

utterances.transcript_with_note: (proudly) Oh, you should here me.

utterances.transcript: It's not something to be proud of, okay? You have to go to a sleep clinic!
Look, I told ya, I'm not going to any clinic! I don't have a problem, you're the one with the problem! You should go to a "Quit being a baby and leave me alone" clinic!
Yeah, they do! Quit being a baby and leave me alone! There, you've just had your first class!
Y'know I used to go out with this guy that was a really light sleeper, and whenever I started to snore, he would just roll me over...
He would just roll me over and I would stop snoring.
Next time you snore, I'm rolling ya over!
I gotta do what I gotta do, you gotta do what you gotta do, you just do it.

(Joey starts humming Here Come the Bride.)

utterances.transcript: Have you guys picked a date yet?
I still cannot believe you're engaged! Just 'cause its happening so fast; not 'cause you're such a loser.
utterances.transcript_with_note: I still cannot believe you're engaged! (Ross looks at her) Just 'cause its happening so fast; not 'cause you're such a loser.

utterances.transcript: Oh. Thanks. Uh, has anyone seen Rach?

I'll pick it up for you!

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is not doing the dishes. She hears someone coming up the stairs and quickly puts down her magazine and pretends like she's actually doing the dishes.]

utterances.transcript: Hey, Mon, I was just doing the dishes!

utterances.transcript_with_note: Oh! It's you. (She stops doing the dishes.) Hi.

utterances.transcript: Hey, do uh, do you have a minute?
Yeah, yeah, I was just about to take a break anyways, so...
So listen uh, I know you and I haven't really had a chance to talk since uh, Emily and I decided to get married, and uh, I was just wondering how you were.
I know if you were getting married I'd feel, kinda..... y'know.
Yeah. Yeah. Definitely, well it definitely took me by surprise, but I'm okay.
All right, I just wanted to check.

utterances.transcript_with_note: (He goes over to hug her.)

utterances.transcript: You're great. And I-I know someday this will happen for you too. You just hang in there.

utterances.transcript_with_note: (breaking the hug) Uhh, hang in there?

utterances.transcript: Oh, no, I didn't mean, uh...
I mean maybe you didn't hear about a serious relationship called me and Joshua?
Oh, I thought you guys had just been on like four dates, I didn't realise that had become anything, yet.
Oh, no-no-no, no-no-no, it has become, it has-yeah. Oh no, those were four great dates.
Yeah. Oh, yeah. And I mean, the connection, I mean y'know, emotionally, mentally, physically...
I know isn't it? It's like I'm right there with Joshua.
You are right there with Emily. And it's y'know, it's kinda like.... it's a tie! Well, I gotta get, I gotta get back to the dishes.
Hey, y'know, y'know what would make me really happy?
If like the four of us could all y'know, hang out together. Uh, in fact Emily's coming into town this weekend, why don't you say we all have dinner? Say, Sunday night?
Yeah, all right, it's a date.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Yeah, all right, it's a date. (He leaves)

utterances.transcript: Hang in there. You hang in there.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (to the closed door) Hang in there. You hang in there. (Gives him the raspberry.)

No, just singing. (Does a little song.)

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is complaining about going to the clinic.]

utterances.transcript: This sucks! I didn't know I had to stay up all night before I went to this stupid sleep clinic! I'm so tired!

utterances.transcript_with_note: (entering) Hi!

utterances.transcript: Hey, I hear that you and Joshua are going out to dinner with Ross and Emily, and I think that's, I think that's really cool.
Yeah, Rach, I think you're handling that really well.
Handling it? What do you mean, handling it? There's nothing to handle. Now, maybe I would have a problem with this if it wasn't for me and Joshua. Y'know, they're not gonna get married anyway!

Come on! They rushed into this thing so fast it's ridiculous! I mean, they're gonna be engaged for like what? A year? And somewhere along the way, one of them is gonna realise what they've done and they're call the whole thing off. I'm telling ya, you're gonna be dancing at my wedding before you're dancing at there's.
Yeah, well, I don't dance at weddings.
Because weddings are a great place to meet women, and when I dance, I look like this...

utterances.transcript: So, what are you guys doing four weeks from today?

utterances.transcript_with_note: I am... (Looks in his date book.) free!

utterances.transcript: Great! Because Emily and I are getting married in a month!

Yeah! Yeah, Emily always wanted to get married in this beautiful place that her parents got married, but it's going to be torn down, so... I mean, I-I know it's crazy, but everything up 'til now has been so crazy, and I don't know, this just feels right. Y'know?

Three people. Joshua's not gonna be there.
Uh, well, I think, I think he broke up with me.
It's okay. Sometimes, things don't work out the way you'd thought they would.

utterances.transcript_with_note: (They hug.)

utterances.transcript: Oh, hey, don't you have to go pick up Emily?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (breaking the hug) Oh, hey, don't you have to go pick up Emily?
(He leaves.)
Ugh. (She goes over and lays her head on Phoebe's lap.)

utterances.transcript: Hey, y'know what might cheer you up?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (looks at Monica) Hey, y'know what might cheer you up?
[Time lapse, all three girls are now wearing wedding dresses, eating popcorn, drinking beer, and watching TV.]

utterances.transcript: Y'know, I gotta tell ya, this really does put in a better mood.
Oh, I wish there was a job where I could wear this all the time. Maybe someday, there will be.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Oh, I wish there was a job where I could wear this all the time. (Pause) Maybe someday, there will be.
(There's a knock on the door.)

utterances.transcript: Oh God! He's gonna come by and borrow some candles for his big date!

utterances.transcript_with_note: Oh, okay! (She goes to answer the door.)

utterances.transcript: No-no, Rachel, don't get it! He can't see us!
No, yeah! The groom cannot see the bride!
Okay, you guys, just relax. I doooo.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Okay, you guys, just relax. (She goes over to open the door, and as she does, she says.) I doooo. (Sees that it's Joshua, not Chandler that knocked on the door.)

utterances.transcript: Oh, wait, Joshua! Joshua! Yeah, well, that oughta do it.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Oh, wait, Joshua! Joshua! (Pause) (Comes back inside) Yeah, well, that oughta do it.

span_qa.question: What is Monica finally doing ?

answers.answer_text: Monica is putting away the wedding dress , finally .

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Chandler's bedroom, he is sleeping with Marjorie. All of the sudden, Marjorie starts talking in her sleep, awakening Chandler. After a little bit, she quiets back down, and Chandler tries to get back to sleep. There's a short pause until she starts screaming, causing Chandler to scream with her. She quickly calms down. This all wakes up Joey, who comes over wearing the mouth guard, opens the top half of Chandler's door, and starts to complain about the noise.]

utterances.transcript: Dude! I am trying to sleep!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (muffled by the mouth guard) Dude! I am trying to sleep! (Shrugs to say, "What's up with that?")
